com.ibm.team.scm.common

Class AcceptFlags

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.team.scm.common.AcceptFlags

  • public class AcceptFlags
extends java.lang.Object
    This class identifies different flags for the accepting or resuming of change sets into a workspace. Accept/resume supports the following permutations which can be expressed through bitmasks:
    • preflight (let me know what the operation would have done if it ran to completion) or not (run the operation to completion).
    • allow_gaps (allow gaps to be tolerated).
    • use specified change set ordering or have the server re-order the change sets as it believes would be necessary.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CREATE_CURRENT_PATCH
      This flag is used in conjunction with the PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag.
      static int CREATE_CURRENT_PATCH_WITH_AUTO_RESOLVE
      This flag is used in conjunction with the PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag.
      static int CURRENT_PATCH_HANDLING_MASK
      Mask used to extract the current port handling directive from the accept flags
      static int DEFAULT
      Perform the operation without any special options.
      static int DO_NOT_REORDER
      Perform the operation without re-ordering.
      static int INITIATE_AUTO_PATCH
      This flag is used in conjunction with the PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag.
      static int PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS
      If there is a gap introduced by the accept, let the accept proceed and have any gapped change sets be queued as pending ports.
      static int PREFLIGHT
      Perform the operation in preflight/read-only mode, i.e. let the client know what the operation would have done if it was allowed to write to the workspace.
      static int REDUCE_N_WAY_DUE_TO_REORDER
      This flag is used to indicate that the accept should reduce any n-way conflicts that are caused by history reordering by creating a change set that contains the required merges.
      static int REPORT_DELETE_CONFLICTS
      This flag is used to indicate that delete/delete conflicts should be reported as conflicts.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT

        public static final int DEFAULT
        Perform the operation without any special options. Change sets may be reordered by the server when accepting/resuming.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DO_NOT_REORDER

        public static final int DO_NOT_REORDER
        Perform the operation without re-ordering. Change sets will be accepted/resumed in the order as specified by the client.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PREFLIGHT

        public static final int PREFLIGHT
        Perform the operation in preflight/read-only mode, i.e. let the client know what the operation would have done if it was allowed to write to the workspace.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS

        public static final int PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS
        If there is a gap introduced by the accept, let the accept proceed and have any gapped change sets be queued as pending ports. If this flag is not set and gaps occur, the accept will fail.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CURRENT_PATCH_HANDLING_MASK

        public static final int CURRENT_PATCH_HANDLING_MASK
        Mask used to extract the current port handling directive from the accept flags
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CREATE_CURRENT_PATCH

        public static final int CREATE_CURRENT_PATCH
        This flag is used in conjunction with the PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag. When both the PORT_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag and this flag are set, the server will make the first pending port the current port but will not auto-resolve any changes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CREATE_CURRENT_PATCH_WITH_AUTO_RESOLVE

        public static final int CREATE_CURRENT_PATCH_WITH_AUTO_RESOLVE
        This flag is used in conjunction with the PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag. When both the PORT_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag and this flag are set, the server will make the first pending port the current port and auto-resolve as many changes in the current port as possible.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INITIATE_AUTO_PATCH

        public static final int INITIATE_AUTO_PATCH
        This flag is used in conjunction with the PATCH_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag. When both the PORT_CHANGESETS_WITH_GAPS flag and this flag are set, the server will make an attempt to auto-port as many of the gapped change sets as possible. The first change set that cannot be auto-ported will become the current port while the remaining will be left on the pending port list.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REDUCE_N_WAY_DUE_TO_REORDER

        public static final int REDUCE_N_WAY_DUE_TO_REORDER
        This flag is used to indicate that the accept should reduce any n-way conflicts that are caused by history reordering by creating a change set that contains the required merges.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REPORT_DELETE_CONFLICTS

        public static final int REPORT_DELETE_CONFLICTS
        This flag is used to indicate that delete/delete conflicts should be reported as conflicts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
